name: grouchily
content:

in a way that shows you are annoyed and ready to complain: "No, I don't like it - I never have," he said, grouchily. "Thanks for nothing," she muttered grouchily. Related words

More examplesFewer examples"You haven't done anything at all," she pointed out, a little grouchily. They were grouchily told not to refer to him in that way."What do you mean?" I retorted grouchily. He insisted, correctly but grouchily, that he had not changed anything.She reflected a touch grouchily that she was feeling rather unsure about everything.
